content.sub_configuration_introduction:
This rule has an object option, with one option:
"capIsConstructor": false(defaulttrue) disables the assumption that a function which name starts with an uppercase is a constructor.
By default, this rule always allows the use ofthisin functions which name starts with an uppercase and anonymous functions that are assigned to a variable which name starts with an uppercase, assuming that those functions are used as constructor functions.
Set"capIsConstructor"tofalseif you want those functions to be treated as ‘regular’ functions.
